content.raw:
You shouldn't have to. Other people's branches get closed just fine when they are merged.

This is interesting: In @ReneKolb's pull requests, he is listed as the committer of the merge commits:

![merges.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/g75Ex9/images/3465635430-merges.png)

Whereas for your pull requests, Phil or me is listed as the committer:

![merges2.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/g75Ex9/images/3167354253-merges2.png)

Edit: 

Ah so it looks like @ReneKolb probably closed his own branches and then made a pull request for his default branch, so that's different.
